Classify biomarker values based on thresholds and quantification limits

Source: R/classify.R
classify.Rd

classify() is a general-purpose function for discretising continuous biomarker values into categorical levels based on user-defined cut-points. It also handles values outside the quantifiable range, using optional labels for values below the lower limit of quantification (LLOQ) or above the upper limit (ULOQ), if provided via names in the loq argument.

Usage

classify(
  x,
  cutpoints,
  levels,
  loq = c(-Inf, Inf),
  right = TRUE,
  include.lowest = TRUE
)

Arguments

x

Numeric vector of biomarker values.

cutpoints

Numeric vector of cut-off points. Must be strictly increasing.

levels

Character vector of classification labels, with length equal to length(cutpoints) + 1.

loq

Numeric vector of length 2 specifying quantification limits: lower (LLOQ) and upper (ULOQ). Default: c(-Inf, Inf). Optionally, you can name the elements to assign labels to values outside the range, e.g.: c("Below LLOQ" = 100, "Above ULOQ" = 2000).

right

Logical. Intervals are right-closed (i.e. (a, b]). Default: TRUE.

include.lowest

Logical. Include the lowest value in the first interval. Default: TRUE.

Value

A factor with classification levels, including optional labels for values outside the quantifiable range.

Examples

classify(
  x = c(10, 75, 130, 2050),
  cutpoints = c(50, 150),
  levels = c("low", "medium", "high"),
  loq = c("Below LLOQ" = 20, "Above ULOQ" = 2000)
)
#> [1] Below LLOQ medium     medium     Above ULOQ
#> Levels: Below LLOQ low medium high Above ULOQ
